Di Era Jokowi, Realisasi Investasi Tol Cuma 28% dari Target
06 Nov 2019, 08:02 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Kementerian PUPR

Jakarta - Realisasi investasi tol yang dikerjasamakan dengan swasta lewat skema kerja sama pemerintah dan badan usaha (KPBU) atau public private partnership (PPP) periode 2015-2019 hanya mencapai 28% atau sekitar Rp 142 triliun. Angka ini terhitung rendah dari total target investasi yang dibutuhkan mencapai Rp 500 triliun."Tol targetnya Rp 500 triliun. Realisasi 28 persen," kata Dirjen Pembiayaan Infrastruktur Kementerian PUPR Eko D Heripoerwanto saat ditemui di sela acara Indonesia Infrastructure Week di JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Adapun total proyek tol yang ditawarkan untuk skema KPBU mencapai 43 proyek dengan panjang 985 km. Realisasi investasi PPP untuk proyek Sistem Penyediaan Air Minum (SPAM) bahkan lebih kecil lagi, hanya mencakup 19% atau Rp 3,8 triliun dari target Rp 20,15 triliun."Kami mendorong realisasi lebih besar. Ada state guarantee model, pemerintah beri garansi dan dukungan. Ada bond issuance," kata Eko.Pemerintah sendiri membutuhkan partisipasi yang lebih besar lagi dari swasta dalam pembangunan infrastruktur lima tahun ke depan. Keterbatasan APBN membuat pemerintah harus putar otak menarik investor masuk ke dalam investasi di bidang jalan, air hingga perumahan.Untuk periode 2020-2024, masih ada Rp 1.435 triliun gap pembiayaan pembangunan infrastruktur yang dibutuhkan. Kemampuan APBN dalam untuk proyek-proyek tersebut diperkirakan hanya mencakup 30% dari total biaya yang dibutuhkan atau sekitar Rp 623 triliun, sementara total kebutuhan pembiayaan infrastruktur hingga 2024 mencapai Rp 2.058 triliun.Proyek yang akan dibangun mencakup bidang sumber daya air (SDA) Rp 577 triliun, jalan dan jembatan Rp 573 triliun, perumahan Rp 780 triliun, dan lainnya Rp 128 triliun. In the Jokowi Era, the Realization of Toll Road Investment was only 28% of the Target
Nov 6, 2019, 08:02 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Ministry of PUPR

Jakarta - The realization of toll investment in cooperation with the private sector through the cooperation scheme of the government and business entities (PPP) or public private partnership (PPP) for the 2015-2019 period only reached 28% or around Rp 142 trillion. This figure is lower than the total investment target needed to reach Rp 500 trillion. "Toll target is Rp 500 trillion. Realization is 28 percent," said Director General of Infrastructure Financing of the Ministry of PUPR, Eko D Heripoerwanto when met on the sidelines of the Indonesia Infrastructure Week event at JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). As for the total toll road projects offered for the PPP scheme, there were 43 projects with a length of 985 km. The realization of the PPP investment for the Drinking Water Supply System (SPAM) project is even smaller, covering only 19% or Rp3.8 trillion of the target of Rp.20.15 trillion. "We are pushing for greater realization. There is a state guarantee model, the government guarantees and support. There are bond issues, "said Eko.The government itself needs greater participation from the private sector in infrastructure development in the next five years. The limitations of the state budget make the government have to rack my brain to attract investors into investments in the fields of roads, water to housing. For the period 2020-2024, there is still Rp 1,435 trillion in funding gap for the needed infrastructure development. The ability of the APBN in these projects is estimated to only cover 30% of the total cost needed or around Rp 623 trillion, while the total infrastructure financing needs up to 2024 reach Rp 2,058 trillion. The projects to be built include the field of water resources (SDA) Rp 577 trillion, roads and bridges Rp 573 trillion, housing Rp 780 trillion, and others Rp 128 trillion.
